Curator's comments: Flax, whether linum bienne or linum usitatissimum, was the plant used to make linen, the principal material employed in ancient Egyptian textile production. See Vogelsang-Eastwood, 'Textiles', in P.T. Nicholson and I. Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge, 2000), 269-76. On the use of flax in textile production at a New Kingdom settlement, see B.J. Kemp and G. Vogelsang-Eastwood, The Ancient Textile Industry at Amarna (Excavation Memoir 68, EES, London)
